intro: Sedum coriaceum, commonly known as stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid and rocky environments. It features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically gray-green in color, adapted for water storage. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white during the summer months. It is often found growing on cliffs, walls, or in dry soils. Sedum coriaceum is a hardy, low-maintenance plant suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
